sourceMeaningMnemonic: If you take a <radical>cow</radical>'s <radical>life</radical> you're turning it into an <kanji>offering</kanji>. In the old days, cows' lives were given to the gods as offerings pretty often.
meaningInfo: Picture yourself offering the cow's life up to the god(s). It's a good thing we don't actually have to do this anymore, you think.
readingMnemonic: You prepare the <kanji>offering</kanji> with your holy blue <reading>sa</reading>ber (<ja>せい</ja>). Normally this would be gruesome, but your saber glows and the cow's life shoots up into the sky without you laying a hand on it.
readingInfo: Thanks to the mercy of your saber, the offering is quick and painless. A normal saber, however, would have cut that cow to bits. Like, really just wrecked it. Good thing we didn't make you think about that, huh?
